verses.kjv: But a certain man named Ananias, with Sapphira his wife, sold a possession,
verses.web: But a certain man named Ananias, with Sapphira, his wife, sold a possession,
verses.ct: Now a man named Ananias, along with his wife Sapphira, sold a piece of property.

verses.kjv: And kept back part of the price, his wife also being privy to it, and brought a certain part, and laid it at the apostles’ feet.
verses.web: and kept back part of the price, his wife also being aware of it, then brought a certain part and laid it at the apostles’ feet.
verses.ct: With his wife's full knowledge, he kept back some of the money for himself. Then he brought the rest and laid it at the apostles' feet.

verses.kjv: But Peter said, Ananias, why hath Satan filled thine heart to lie to the Holy Ghost, and to keep back part of the price of the land?
verses.web: But Peter said, “Ananias, why has Satan filled your heart to lie to the Holy Spirit and to keep back part of the price of the land?
verses.ct: Peter said, "Ananias, why has Satan filled your heart to lie to the Holy Spirit and keep back part of the money you received for the land?

verses.kjv: Whiles it remained, was it not thine own? and after it was sold, was it not in thine own power? why hast thou conceived this thing in thine heart? thou hast not lied unto men, but unto God.
verses.web: While you kept it, didn’t it remain your own? After it was sold, wasn’t it in your power? How is it that you have conceived this thing in your heart? You haven’t lied to men, but to God.”
verses.ct: Before you sold it, wasn't it yours to keep? And after you sold it, wasn't the money yours to do with as you pleased? What made you think up this scheme in your heart? You haven't lied to people — you've lied to God."

verses.kjv: And Ananias hearing these words fell down, and gave up the ghost: and great fear came on all them that heard these things.
verses.web: Ananias, hearing these words, fell down and died. Great fear came on all who heard these things.
verses.ct: The moment Ananias heard these words, he collapsed and breathed his last. Everyone who heard about it was gripped with fear.

verses.kjv: And the young men arose, wound him up, and carried him out, and buried him.
verses.web: The young men arose and wrapped him up, and they carried him out and buried him.
verses.ct: Some young men got up, wrapped his body, carried him out, and buried him.

verses.kjv: And it was about the space of three hours after, when his wife, not knowing what was done, came in.
verses.web: About three hours later, his wife, not knowing what had happened, came in.
verses.ct: About 3 hours later, his wife came in, completely unaware of what had happened.

verses.kjv: And Peter answered unto her, Tell me whether ye sold the land for so much? And she said, Yea, for so much.
verses.web: Peter answered her, “Tell me whether you sold the land for so much.” She said, “Yes, for so much.”
verses.ct: Peter asked her, "Tell me — did you and your husband sell the land for this amount?" She answered, "Yes, that was the price."

verses.kjv: Then Peter said unto her, How is it that ye have agreed together to tempt the Spirit of the Lord? behold, the feet of them which have buried thy husband are at the door, and shall carry thee out.
verses.web: But Peter asked her, “How is it that you have agreed together to tempt the Spirit of the Lord? Behold, the feet of those who have buried your husband are at the door, and they will carry you out.”
verses.ct: Peter said to her, "How could the two of you agree to test the Spirit of the Lord? Listen — the men who just buried your husband are at the door, and they will carry you out too."

verses.kjv: Then fell she down straightway at his feet, and yielded up the ghost: and the young men came in, and found her dead, and, carrying her forth, buried her by her husband.
verses.web: She fell down immediately at his feet and died. The young men came in and found her dead, and they carried her out and buried her by her husband.
verses.ct: Instantly she fell down at his feet and breathed her last. When the young men came in and found her dead, they carried her out and buried her beside her husband.

verses.kjv: And great fear came upon all the church, and upon as many as heard these things.
verses.web: Great fear came on the whole assembly, and on all who heard these things.
verses.ct: Deep fear swept through the entire church and everyone else who heard what had happened.

verses.kjv: And by the hands of the apostles were many signs and wonders wrought among the people; (and they were all with one accord in Solomon’s porch.
verses.web: By the hands of the apostles many signs and wonders were done among the people. They were all with one accord in Solomon’s porch.
verses.ct: The apostles performed many signs and wonders among the people. All the believers would gather together in Solomon's Porch.

verses.kjv: And of the rest durst no man join himself to them: but the people magnified them.
verses.web: None of the rest dared to join them, however the people honored them.
verses.ct: No outsider dared to join them, yet the people held them in high regard.

verses.kjv: And believers were the more added to the Lord, multitudes both of men and women.)
verses.web: More believers were added to the Lord, multitudes of both men and women.
verses.ct: Still, more and more people — crowds of both men and women — put their faith in the Lord.

verses.kjv: Insomuch that they brought forth the sick into the streets, and laid them on beds and couches, that at the least the shadow of Peter passing by might overshadow some of them.
verses.web: They even carried out the sick into the streets, and laid them on cots and mattresses, so that as Peter came by, at the least his shadow might overshadow some of them.
verses.ct: People even carried the sick out into the streets and laid them on cots and mats, hoping that at least Peter's shadow might fall on some of them as he walked by.

verses.kjv: There came also a multitude out of the cities round about unto Jerusalem, bringing sick folks, and them which were vexed with unclean spirits: and they were healed every one.
verses.web: The multitude also came together from the cities around Jerusalem, bringing sick people and those who were tormented by unclean spirits: and they were all healed.
verses.ct: Crowds also poured in from the towns surrounding Jerusalem, bringing those who were sick or tormented by unclean spirits, and every one of them was healed.

verses.kjv: Then the high priest rose up, and all they that were with him, (which is the sect of the Sadducees,) and were filled with indignation,
verses.web: But the high priest rose up, and all those who were with him (which is the sect of the Sadducees), and they were filled with jealousy
verses.ct: This provoked the high priest and all his associates — the party of the Sadducees — and they were filled with jealousy.

verses.kjv: And laid their hands on the apostles, and put them in the common prison.
verses.web: and laid hands on the apostles, then put them in public custody.
verses.ct: They arrested the apostles and threw them into the public jail.

verses.kjv: But the angel of the Lord by night opened the prison doors, and brought them forth, and said,
verses.web: But an angel of the Lord opened the prison doors by night, and brought them out and said,
verses.ct: But during the night, an angel of the Lord opened the prison doors, led them out, and said,

verses.kjv: Go, stand and speak in the temple to the people all the words of this life.
verses.web: “Go stand and speak in the temple to the people all the words of this life.”
verses.ct: "Go stand in the temple and tell the people everything about this new life."

verses.kjv: And when they heard that, they entered into the temple early in the morning, and taught. But the high priest came, and they that were with him, and called the council together, and all the senate of the children of Israel, and sent to the prison to have them brought.
verses.web: When they heard this, they entered into the temple about daybreak and taught. But the high priest came, and those who were with him, and called the council together, and all the senate of the children of Israel, and sent to the prison to have them brought.
verses.ct: They obeyed, entering the temple at daybreak and beginning to teach. Meanwhile, the high priest and his associates convened the full council — the entire senate of Israel — and sent officers to the prison to bring the apostles before them.

verses.kjv: But when the officers came, and found them not in the prison, they returned, and told,
verses.web: But the officers who came didn’t find them in the prison. They returned and reported,
verses.ct: But when the officers arrived at the jail, the apostles were gone. They went back and reported,

verses.kjv: Saying, The prison truly found we shut with all safety, and the keepers standing without before the doors: but when we had opened, we found no man within.
verses.web: “We found the prison shut and locked, and the guards standing before the doors, but when we opened them, we found no one inside!”
verses.ct: "We found the prison securely locked, with the guards standing at their posts in front of the doors. But when we opened them, no one was inside!"

verses.kjv: Now when the high priest and the captain of the temple and the chief priests heard these things, they doubted of them whereunto this would grow.
verses.web: Now when the high priest, the captain of the temple, and the chief priests heard these words, they were very perplexed about them and what might become of this.
verses.ct: When the captain of the temple guard and the chief priests heard this, they were completely baffled, wondering where this would all lead.

verses.kjv: Then came one and told them, saying, Behold, the men whom ye put in prison are standing in the temple, and teaching the people.
verses.web: One came and told them, “Behold, the men whom you put in prison are in the temple, standing and teaching the people.”
verses.ct: Then someone arrived with news: "The men you locked up are standing in the temple, teaching the people!"

verses.kjv: Then went the captain with the officers, and brought them without violence: for they feared the people, lest they should have been stoned.
verses.web: Then the captain went with the officers, and brought them without violence, for they were afraid that the people might stone them.
verses.ct: So the captain went with his officers and brought the apostles back — but without force, because they were afraid the crowd might stone them.

verses.kjv: And when they had brought them, they set them before the council: and the high priest asked them,
verses.web: When they had brought them, they set them before the council. The high priest questioned them,
verses.ct: They brought them in and made them stand before the council. The high priest confronted them,

verses.kjv: Saying, Did not we straitly command you that ye should not teach in this name? and, behold, ye have filled Jerusalem with your doctrine, and intend to bring this man’s blood upon us.
verses.web: saying, “Didn’t we strictly command you not to teach in this name? Behold, you have filled Jerusalem with your teaching, and intend to bring this man’s blood on us.”
verses.ct: saying, "Didn't we give you strict orders not to teach in this name? Yet you've flooded Jerusalem with your teaching, and you're trying to make us responsible for this man's death!"

verses.kjv: Then Peter and the other apostles answered and said, We ought to obey God rather than men.
verses.web: But Peter and the apostles answered, “We must obey God rather than men.
verses.ct: Peter and the other apostles replied, "We must obey God rather than people.

verses.kjv: The God of our fathers raised up Jesus, whom ye slew and hanged on a tree.
verses.web: The God of our fathers raised up Jesus, whom you killed, hanging him on a tree.
verses.ct: The God of our ancestors raised Jesus back to life — the very one you killed by hanging him on a cross.

verses.kjv: Him hath God exalted with his right hand to be a Prince and a Saviour, for to give repentance to Israel, and forgiveness of sins.
verses.web: God exalted him with his right hand to be a Prince and a Savior, to give repentance to Israel, and remission of sins.
verses.ct: God lifted him up to his right hand as Prince and Savior, to offer Israel the chance to repent and receive forgiveness of sins.

verses.kjv: And we are his witnesses of these things; and so is also the Holy Ghost, whom God hath given to them that obey him.
verses.web: We are his witnesses of these things; and so also is the Holy Spirit, whom God has given to those who obey him.”
verses.ct: We are witnesses to all of this, and so is the Holy Spirit, whom God has given to everyone who obeys him."

verses.kjv: When they heard that, they were cut to the heart, and took counsel to slay them.
verses.web: But they, when they heard this, were cut to the heart, and were determined to kill them.
verses.ct: When the council members heard this, they were furious and wanted to have them killed.

verses.kjv: Then stood there up one in the council, a Pharisee, named Gamaliel, a doctor of the law, had in reputation among all the people, and commanded to put the apostles forth a little space;
verses.web: But one stood up in the council, a Pharisee named Gamaliel, a teacher of the law, honored by all the people, and commanded to put the apostles out for a little while.
verses.ct: But a Pharisee named Gamaliel stood up in the council. He was a respected teacher of the law, honored by all the people. He ordered the apostles to be taken outside for a moment.

verses.kjv: And said unto them, Ye men of Israel, take heed to yourselves what ye intend to do as touching these men.
verses.web: He said to them, “You men of Israel, be careful concerning these men, what you are about to do.
verses.ct: Then he addressed the council: "Men of Israel, think carefully about what you're planning to do with these men.

verses.kjv: For before these days rose up Theudas, boasting himself to be somebody; to whom a number of men, about four hundred, joined themselves: who was slain; and all, as many as obeyed him, were scattered, and brought to nought.
verses.web: For before these days Theudas rose up, making himself out to be somebody; to whom a number of men, about four hundred, joined themselves. He was slain; and all, as many as obeyed him, were dispersed, and came to nothing.
verses.ct: Some time ago, Theudas appeared, claiming to be someone important. About 400 men rallied behind him. But he was killed, and all his followers scattered and disappeared.

verses.kjv: After this man rose up Judas of Galilee in the days of the taxing, and drew away much people after him: he also perished; and all, even as many as obeyed him, were dispersed.
verses.web: After this man, Judas of Galilee rose up in the days of the enrollment, and drew away some people after him. He also perished, and all, as many as obeyed him, were scattered abroad.
verses.ct: After him, Judas of Galilee came along during the time of the census and attracted a following. He too was killed, and all his followers were scattered.

verses.kjv: And now I say unto you, Refrain from these men, and let them alone: for if this counsel or this work be of men, it will come to nought:
verses.web: Now I tell you, withdraw from these men, and leave them alone. For if this counsel or this work is of men, it will be overthrown.
verses.ct: So my advice is this: stay away from these men and leave them alone. If what they're planning and doing is merely human, it will collapse on its own.

verses.kjv: But if it be of God, ye cannot overthrow it; lest haply ye be found even to fight against God.
verses.web: But if it is of God, you will not be able to overthrow it, and you would be found even to be fighting against God!”
verses.ct: But if it is from God, you won't be able to stop them. You'll only find yourselves fighting against God."

verses.kjv: And to him they agreed: and when they had called the apostles, and beaten them, they commanded that they should not speak in the name of Jesus, and let them go.
verses.web: They agreed with him. Summoning the apostles, they beat them and commanded them not to speak in the name of Jesus, and let them go.
verses.ct: The council was persuaded. They called the apostles back in, had them beaten, ordered them not to speak in the name of Jesus, and released them.

verses.kjv: And they departed from the presence of the council, rejoicing that they were counted worthy to suffer shame for his name.
verses.web: They therefore departed from the presence of the council, rejoicing that they were counted worthy to suffer dishonor for Jesus’ name.
verses.ct: The apostles left the council overjoyed that they had been considered worthy to suffer disgrace for the name of Jesus.

verses.kjv: And daily in the temple, and in every house, they ceased not to teach and preach Jesus Christ.
verses.web: Every day, in the temple and at home, they never stopped teaching and preaching Jesus, the Christ.
verses.ct: Every day, both in the temple and from house to house, they never stopped teaching and proclaiming that Jesus is the Christ.
